Text.Value: Would some gold help you find the real offender? ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])
*Gold may have made your problem go away this time, but next time you won't be so lucky.*
*A blind eye can only be bought so many times. This was the last of those times.*
*Improperly-acquired coin weighs heavy on the conscience. The bribe may have worked this time, but it won't work the next.*
*Perhaps it was unwise to reveal just how much gold you have on your person.*
*You're surprised to learn you can't pay your way out of this one. Violence it is.*
*Your gold is good for many situations, but apparently not here. You're going to pay in blood.*
How do I know you're not the criminal?
I've not seen anyone suspicious. You'll be the first to hear if I do.
You seem very stressed. Why don't you take a break? This miscreant can wait.
*You've been given the benefit of the doubt this time, but something tells you next time you won't be so lucky.*
*You may have talked your way out of this one, but there will be no repeat performance.*
*You'll walk free, for now, but your stories won't land so well if you're caught again.*
*The guard seems convinced of one thing. You're the criminal who needs to be stopped.*
*You hoped you'd get away with that. Unfortunately, you haven't.*
*Your words are of no interest. The time for talking is over.*
*Your speech isn't persuasive. You sense this will be resolved in a more violent manner.*
Try talking your way out of the situation.
*The situation is quickly resolved. Clearly you're not the one responsible.*
*A case of mistaken identity - you obviously aren't the criminal in question.*
*It seems you're free to go. For now.*
*A criminal would never speak with such integrity. You must be innocent.*
*Try as you might, your efforts are not convincing enough. The guards will deal with this.*
*You sense the guards will be hearing of this.*
*If your guilt wasn't confirmed before, it is now. The guards are being summoned.*
*You managed to get away with that. Better not try your luck too often.*
*You speak with conviction. Whoever did this, it obviously wasn't you.*
*The accusation is withdrawn. It's wisest not to accuse you of this particular crime.*
You don't want to make an enemy of me.
Go on - accuse me again. I dare you.
I wouldn't go pointing fingers, unless you want them snapped off.
Attack.
*You're sure the gold will be most useful in catching the one responsible.*
*The clink of gold leaving your purse - the sound of repercussions deftly avoided.*
*Your gold was more than enough to defuse the situation. You're free to go.*
*You've successfully persuaded the guard that you belong in a cell.*
*You argue your case, but it makes no difference. You're going to be locked up.*
*You hope for a glimmer of understanding. No such luck. It's the cells for you.*
*Freedom demands a high price, and your speech was not valuable enough. You're headed for the cells.*
I think you have me confused with someone else.
Me? I've been minding my own business.
I haven't seen anything suspicious.
*A crime's being investigated in this area. You appear to be the prime suspect.*
*A criminal act is being investigated. You might want to explain the extent of your involvement.*
*A crime's been committed, and this guard's decided to investigate. Investigate you, to be specific.*
Attack.
*You could offer the lint in your purse, but you doubt that's valid currency.*
*Your humble purse won't cover this. Perhaps your golden tongue can help instead.*
*You don't have the gold to buy your way out of this situation.*
Acquiesce and follow.
*Your gold buys contempt, but not freedom. You're about to be detained.*
*Perhaps offering a bribe wasn't the best way to prove your innocence. You're under arrest.*
*Your bribe only reveals the truth: you're the criminal, and criminals belong in a cell.*
*There's a criminal on the loose. You realise you're about to be accused...*
*A crime's taken place nearby. You sense an accusation might be coming...*
*There's a hunt underway. A crime has been reported, and you appear to be under suspicion.*
I'm investigating that same crime - leave it to me.
A criminal? Me? I'm scandalised!
I've got a lead on the true culprit. Leave me be so I can follow it.

Synopsis: An NPC noticed a crime scene, or was told about a crime by another NPC, and is interrogating a suspected player.
